result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone M Isaac Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any family members of DG.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JPD.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

AMENDED CASH BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
$750,000 per case
- Defendant shall may have contact with Josezette B. through phone calls and jail visits.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Aaliyah M., Shante C., Alvin M., Jonpaul D., Dejuante C., Nelson J., Demario W., Tyrone M., or Jamar S.-J.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Shelly Rusch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed
